qas.question: The United Kingdom is part of what union?
What does the Schengen area allow in the European Union?

answers.text: passport-free travel between EU members states

qas.question: When was a free-travel area created betwen Northern Ireland and Ireland?
This free-travel area in Ireland is now called what?
Ireland and the Crown Dependencies are part of what union?

plausible_answers.text: passport-free travel between EU members states.

qas.question: What type of travel does the Amsterdam Treaty area allow?
Both the United Kingdom and Ireland are part of what area?
A formal free-travel area has existed across the region since when?
Since 1997 the area has required informal recognition and has become known as what?

context: Ireland and the United Kingdom are both part of the <a0_0><b4_0>European Union<b4_0/> (EU)<a0_0/>. The Crown Dependencies are not a part of the EU however do participate in certain aspects that were negotiated as a part of the UK's accession to the EU. Neither the United Kingdom or Ireland are part of the <b6_0>Schengen area<b6_0/>, that allow <a1_0><b5_0>passport-free travel between EU members states<a1_0/>.<b5_0/> However, since <b7_0>the partition of Ireland<b7_0/>, an informal free-travel area had existed across the region. In <a2_0>1997<a2_0/>, this area required formal recognition during the course of negotiations for the Amsterdam Treaty of the European Union and is now known as <b8_0>the <a3_0>Common Travel Area<a3_0/>.
